lead_paragraph: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jul 1 -- The raid carried out in Commando fashion by United Nations troops at Salamaua, New Guinea, was hailed here today, but it should be emphasized that this attack was harassing only, with no more important significance. Salamaua is still in the hands of the Japanese, who operate one of their principal air bases there.
abstract: Commando troops in Salamaua raid discussed
snippet: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jul 1 -- The raid carried out in Commando fashion by United Nations troops at Salamaua, New Guinea, was hailed here today, but it should be emphasized that this attack was harassing only, with no more important significance. ...

byline.original: By BYRON DARNTONSpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
